channel.title: AKS Quickstart on Tools for running HashiCorp Vault on Kubernetes
channel.description: Recent content in AKS Quickstart on Tools for running HashiCorp Vault on Kubernetes

item.title: AKS Quickstart
item.description: Running Kubernetes on Azure AKS Following example will use pharmer to create a Kubernetes cluster with 1 worker node server and a master server (i,e, 2 servers in you cluster) in Azure AJS. Before you start As a prerequisite, you need to have pharmer installed. To install pharmer use the setup guide Pharmer storage To store your cluster and credential resource, you can configure pharmer to use local file system or postgres database.
